menu.starting-deck: Use all attack cards with the hexagon weapon icon to create your hunter attack deck.
menu.time-add: Shuffle the {0} card into time deck.
menu.reveal-hunt: Reveal your track tokens, check the Scoutfly level, and begin the hunting phase.

levels.skill: Each time this monster deals 1 or more damage to a hunter it regains 1 lost health.
levels.head: Behaviours with [water] inflict physical damage instead of elemental damage.

levels.skill: Each time this monster deals 1 or more damage to a hunter it regains 1 lost health. While this monster has at least 1 broken body part, behaviours this monster performs gain +1 [attack] and +1 [dodge].
levels.head: Behaviours with [water] inflict physical damage instead of elemental damage.

levels.skill: Each time this monster deals 1 or more damage to a hunter it regains 1 lost health. Behaviours gain +1 [attack] and +1 [dodge].
levels.head: Behaviours with [water] inflict physical damage instead of elemental damage.
levels.torso: The monster doesn't regain lost health when it damages hunters.

levels.skill: The first time Barroth moves onto a pond node, remove 1 [break] from each body part that isn't broken.
levels.head: Behaviours with [head] have -1 [movement].

levels.skill: Each time Barroth moves onto a pond node, remove 1 [break] from each body part that isn't broken.
levels.head: Behaviours with [head] have -1 [movement].
levels.claws: Discard the top card of the monster's behaviour deck.

levels.skill: Each time Barroth moves onto a pond node, remove 1 [break] from each body part that isn't broken. Behaviour gain +1 [attack].
levels.head: Behaviours with [head] have -1 [movement].
levels.claws: Discard the top card of the monster's behaviour deck.
levels.tail: The monster no longer removes break tokens when it moves onto a pond node.

levels.skill: After resolving a [claws] behaviour card, Kulu-Ya-Ku gains +2 [armor] on its [head] and [claws] body parts until its next turn.
Behaviours with [claws] gain +1 [attack]. After resolving a [claws] behaviour card, Kulu-Ya-Ku gains +2 [armor] on its [head] and [claws] body parts until its next turn.
levels.head: Behaviours have -1 [dodge].

levels.skill: Behaviours with [claws] gain +1 [attack] and +1 [dodge]. After resolving a [claws] behaviour card, Kulu-Ya-Ku gains +2 [armor] on its [head] and [claws] body parts until its next turn.
levels.head: Behaviours have -1 [dodge].
levels.leg: Remove the top card from the behaviour deck. Shuffle discarded behaviour cards into the deck.

levels.skill: When hunters suffer [poison] from Pukei-Pukei they lose 3 health at the end of their turn instead of 2.
When hunters suffer [poison] from Pukei-Pukei they lose 3 health at the end of their turn instead of 2. Behaviours with [poison] gain +1 [dodge].
When hunters suffer [poison] from Pukei-Pukei they lose 3 health at the end of their turn instead of 2. Behaviours gain +1 [dodge].
levels.head: [poison] causes hunters to lose 2 health instead of 3.

levels.skill: When you determine Tobi-Kadachi's target for a [thunder] behaviour remove Tobi-Kadachi from the board. Place Tobi-Kadachi on the farthest rock node from its current node without changing its facing. If there are multiple farthest rock nodes, the players choose. Move any hunters on that node as if Tobi-Kadachi had moved onto the node. Then resolve the behaviour as normal.

When you determine Tobi-Kadachi's target for a [thunder] behaviour remove Tobi-Kadachi from the board. Place Tobi-Kadachi on the farthest rock node from its current node without changing its facing. If there are multiple farthest rock nodes, the players choose. Move any hunters on that node as if Tobi-Kadachi had moved onto the node. Then resolve the behaviour as normal. Behaviours with [thunder] gain +1 [attack].
levels.head: Remove Leaping Bite from the behaviour deck. Shuffle discarded behaviour cards into the deck.

levels.skill: When you determine Tobi-Kadachi's target for a [thunder] behaviour remove Tobi-Kadachi from the board. Place Tobi-Kadachi on the farthest rock node from its current node without changing its facing. If there are multiple farthest rock nodes, the players choose. Move any hunters on that node as if Tobi-Kadachi had moved onto the node. Then resolve the behaviour as normal. Behaviours with [thunder] gain +2 [attack].
levels.head: Remove Leaping Bite from the behaviour deck. Shuffle discarded behaviour cards into the deck.

levels.skill: Each time this monster suffers 4 or more damage from an attack card, after the attack is resolved the monster moves 2 nodes toward [farthest].
levels.head: Behaviours with [fire] inflict -1 [attack].
levels.leg: Remove Crush from the behaviour deck. Shuffle discarded behaviour cards into the deck.

levels.skill: Each time this monster suffers 4 or more damage from an attack card, after the attack is resolved the monster moves 2 nodes toward [farthest]. Behaviours with [fire] gain +1 [attack].
levels.head: Behaviours with [fire] inflict -1 [attack].
levels.torso: Discard the top card of the monster's behaviour deck.

levels.torso: Discard the top card of the monster's behaviour deck.

levels.skill: While Jyuratodus is on a pond node, behaviours gain +1 [dodge].

levels.skill: While Jyuratodus is on a pond node, behaviours gain +1 [attack] and +1 [dodge].
levels.head: Behaviours with [head] have -1 [dodge].

levels.skill: While Jyuratodus is on a pond node, each body part gains +1 [armor] and behaviours gain +1 [attack] and +1 [dodge].
levels.head: Behaviours with [head] have -1 [dodge].

levels.skill: When this monster has 35 health or less, remove the card with [track] from the behaviour deck. Then randomly add 1 of the 3 Rathalos behaviour cards with [track] into this monster's behaviour deck. Shuffle discarded behaviour cards into the deck.
levels.head: Behaviours with [fire] have -1 [range].
levels.wing: Remove Take Off Blast from the behaviour deck. Shuffle discarded behaviour cards into the deck.
levels.tail: Discard the top card of the monster's behaviour deck.

levels.skill: When this monster has 50 health or less, randomly add 1 additional Rathalos behaviour card with [track] into this monster's behaviour deck. Shuffle discarded behaviour cards into the deck. Behaviours with [fire] gain +1 [attack].
levels.head: Behaviours with [fire] have -1 [range].
levels.wing: Remove Take Off Blast from the behaviour deck. Shuffle discarded behaviour cards into the deck.
levels.tail: Discard the top card of the monster's behaviour deck.

levels.skill: When this monster has 55 health or less, add the 2 remaining Rathalos behaviour card with [track] into this monster's behaviour deck. Shuffle discarded behaviour cards into the deck. Behaviours gain +1 [attack] and +1 [dodge].
levels.head: Behaviours with [fire] have -1 [range].
levels.wing: Remove Take Off Blast from the behaviour deck. Shuffle discarded behaviour cards into the deck.
levels.tail: Discard the top card of the monster's behaviour deck.

levels.skill: Each time this monster suffers damage from an attack card, after the attack is resolved the monster moves 1 node away from [closest].
levels.head: Behaviours with [fire] have -1 [range].
levels.torso: Fleeting Instinct moves the monster 2 nodes rather than 1.

levels.skill: Each time this monster suffers damage from an attack card, after the attack is resolved the monster moves 1 node away from [closest]. Behaviours with [fire] gain +1 [attack].
levels.head: Behaviours with [fire] have -1 [range].
levels.torso: Fleeting Instinct moves the monster 2 nodes rather than 1.

levels.head: Behaviours with [fire] have -1 [range].
levels.torso: Fleeting Instinct moves the monster 2 nodes rather than 1.

levels.skill: While performing [head] behaviours, when Diablos moves onto the same node as the hunters those hunters may only move to the node in the centre of Diablos' front arc unless that node isn't available.
levels.head: Behaviours have -1 [attack].
levels.claws: Discard the top card of the monster's behaviour deck.

levels.skill: While performing [head] behaviours, when Diablos moves onto the same node as the hunters those hunters may only move to the node in the centre of Diablos' front arc unless that node isn't available. Behaviours with [head] gain +1 [attack].
levels.head: Behaviours have -1 [attack].
levels.claws: Discard the top card of the monster's behaviour deck.

levels.skill: While performing [head] behaviours, when Diablos moves onto the same node as the hunters those hunters may only move to the node in the centre of Diablos' front arc unless that node isn't available. Behaviours with [head] gain +2 [attack].
levels.head: Behaviours have -1 [attack].
levels.claws: Discard the top card of the monster's behaviour deck.

levels.skill: When you determine Black Diablos' target for a [claws] behaviour remove Black Diablos from the board. Place Black Diablos on the same node as its target without changing its facing. Move any hunters on that node as if Black Diablos had moved onto that node. Then resolve the behaviour as normal.
levels.head: Behaviours have -1 [attack].
levels.claws: Remove 1 [claws] card of your choice from the behaviour deck then shuffle the deck.

levels.skill: When you determine Black Diablos' target for a [claws] behaviour remove Black Diablos from the board. Place Black Diablos on the same node as its target without changing its facing. Move any hunters on that node as if Black Diablos had moved onto that node. Then resolve the behaviour as normal. Behaviours with [claws] gain +1 [attack].
levels.head: Behaviours have -1 [attack].
levels.claws: Remove 1 [claws] card of your choice from the behaviour deck then shuffle the deck.

levels.skill: When you determine Black Diablos' target for a [claws] behaviour remove Black Diablos from the board. Place Black Diablos on the same node as its target without changing its facing. Move any hunters on that node as if Black Diablos had moved onto that node. Then resolve the behaviour as normal. Behaviours with [claws] gain +2 [attack].
levels.head: Behaviours have -1 [attack].
levels.claws: Remove 1 [claws] card of your choice from the behaviour deck then shuffle the deck.

levels.skill: At the start of Kushala Daora's turn, place 1 wind token on its physiology card. If 2 wind tokens are on its physiology card, remove both tokens instead of placing 1. During your turn, when your hunter moves onto a node adjacent to Kushala Daora you must discard attack cards from your hand with a total agility value that equals or exceeds the number of wind tokens currently on its physiology card.
levels.head: Remove Double Bite from the behaviour deck. Shuffle discarded behaviour cards into the deck.
levels.wing: Remove up to 5 tornado tokens from the game board.
levels.tail: Remove up to 2 wind tokens from this monster's physiology card.

levels.skill: At the start of Kushala Daora's turn, place 1 wind token on its physiology card. If 2 wind tokens are on its physiology card, remove both tokens instead of placing 1. During your turn, when your hunter moves onto a node adjacent to Kushala Daora you must discard attack cards from your hand with a total agility value that equals or exceeds the number of wind tokens currently on its physiology card.
levels.head: Behaviours with [head] have +1 [hunter-turn].
levels.wing: Remove up to 4 tornado tokens from the game board.
levels.tail: Remove up to 2 wind tokens from this monster's physiology card.

levels.skill: Behaviours gain +1 [attack]. At the start of Kushala Daora's turn, place 1 wind token on its physiology card. If 2 wind tokens are on its physiology card, remove both tokens instead of placing 1. During your turn, when your hunter moves onto a node adjacent to Kushala Daora you must discard attack cards from your hand with a total agility value that equals or exceeds the number of wind tokens currently on its physiology card.
levels.head: Behaviours with [head] have +1 [hunter-turn].
levels.wing: Remove up to 3 tornado tokens from the game board.
levels.tail: Remove up to 1 wind tokens from this monster's physiology card.

levels.skill: When you attack a body part of Nergigante without spike tokens, place 1 black spike token on that part. After resolving a behaviour card with the [spike] place 1 spike token on each body part. If Nergigante begins its turn with 6 or more spike tokens on its physiology card, resolve the Nergigante Dive [nerg-dive] behaviour card instead of drawing a behaviour card.
levels.head: Remove Horn Gouge from the behaviour deck. Shuffle discarded behaviour cards into the deck.
levels.claws: Discard the top card of the monster's behaviour deck.

levels.skill: When you attack a body part of Nergigante without spike tokens, place 1 black spike token on that part. After resolving a behaviour card with the [spike] place 1 spike token on each body part. If Nergigante begins its turn with 6 or more spike tokens on its physiology card, resolve the Nergigante Dive [nerg-dive] behaviour card instead of drawing a behaviour card.
levels.head: Behaviours with [head] have -1 [attack].
levels.claws: Remove 1 white spike token from each body part.

levels.skill: Behaviours gain +1 [attack]. When you attack a body part of Nergigante without spike tokens, place 1 black spike token on that part. After resolving a behaviour card with the [spike] place 1 spike token on each body part. If Nergigante begins its turn with 6 or more spike tokens on its physiology card, resolve the Nergigante Dive [nerg-dive] behaviour card instead of drawing a behaviour card.
levels.head: Behaviours with [head] have -1 [attack].
levels.claws: Remove 1 white spike token from each body part.

levels.skill: When a hunter ends their turn in a node adjacent to Teostra, the hunter suffers [blast]. If all 12 blackscale dust tokens are on the game board when Teostra begins its turn, resolve the Supernova [supernova] behaviour card instead of drawing a behaviour card. After resolving this behaviour card remove all of the blackscale dust tokens from the board.
levels.head: Remove up to 6 blackscale dust tokens from the game board.

levels.skill: When a hunter ends their turn in a node adjacent to Teostra, the hunter suffers [blast]. If all 12 blackscale dust tokens are on the game board when Teostra begins its turn, resolve the Supernova [supernova] behaviour card instead of drawing a behaviour card. After resolving this behaviour card remove all of the blackscale dust tokens from the board.
levels.head: Remove up to 5 blackscale dust tokens from the game board.
levels.wing: Remove Claw Swipe from the behaviour deck. Shuffle discarded behaviour cards into the deck.

levels.skill: Behaviours gain +1 [attack]. When a hunter ends their turn in a node adjacent to Teostra, the hunter suffers [blast]. If all 12 blackscale dust tokens are on the game board when Teostra begins its turn, resolve the Supernova [supernova] behaviour card instead of drawing a behaviour card. After resolving this behaviour card remove all of the blackscale dust tokens from the board.
levels.head: Remove up to 4 blackscale dust tokens from the game board.
levels.wing: Remove Claw Swipe from the behaviour deck. Shuffle discarded behaviour cards into the deck.

common: Flip your hunter token face down.
Discard 1 attack card from the| rightmost slot of your stamina board.
Discard any number of| attack cards from your hand.
Draw attack cards until there| are 5 cards in your hand.

0.title: Tactical Shift
text: Up to 2 hunters may move up to 1 node each.

1.title: Threat Shift
text: All players pass their hunter token to the player to their left.
The facing of the hunter token each player now has should match the facing of their previous token.

2.title: Monster Retreats
text: Discard 4 time cards.
Each hunter may sharpen their weapon and use a potion from the communal pool.

3.title: Brief Respite
text: You may discard 1 attack card from any slot of your stamina board.

5.title: Wiggly Litchi
text: You may discard all attack cards from your stamina board.

6.title: Paratoad
text: Roll a die:
On a 1-3 place 1 [paralysis] token on the monster's physiology card.
On a 4-6 your hunter suffers [paralysis].

7.title: Sleeptoad
text: Roll a die:
On a 1-3 place 1 [sleep] token on the monster's physiology card.
On a 4-6 your hunter suffers [sleep].

8.title: Poisoncup
text: Roll a die:
On a 1-3 place 1 [poison] token on the monster's physiology card.
On a 4-6 your hunter suffers [poison].

9.title: Nitrotoad
text: Roll a die:
On a 1-3 place 1 [break] token on the monster's body part of your choice.
On a 4-6 your hunter suffers [blast].

10.title: Monster Sleeps
text: Remove 1 [break] from each monster body part that isn't broken.
The monster recovers 5 health.

11.title: Roar
text: Roll a die.
Discard cards from the time deck equal to the amount rolled.

12.title: Suspended Boulder
text: Roll a die:
On a 1-3 the monster suffers 5 damage.
On a 4-6 your hunter suffers 2 damage.

13.title: Rampage
text: During the monster's next turn its behaviour card has 0 [hunter-turn].

14.title: Vespoid Attack
text: Your hunter suffers [paralysis].

15.title: Misread
text: At the start of the monster's next turn, before drawing a behaviour card, discard the top card from the monster's behaviour deck.

16.title: Aimless Wandering
text: If able, each hunter must move 1 node away from the monster.

17.title: Exhaustion
text: Each hunter flips the leftmost face up attack card on their stamina board face down.

18.title: Wake Up!
text: Double the value of any damage cards drawn during the next hunter attack which inflicts damage.

19.title: Rushed Advance
text: Each hunter may move up to 2 nodes.

20.title: Researcher’s Favour
text: During the next player's turn, attack cards which inflict damage gain +1 [break].

21.title: Ancient Guardian
text: If the monster resolves a movement symbol during its next behaviour, reduce the symbol's value by 2 to a minimum of 0.

22.title: Jagras Slayer
text: If you complete this quest, each player may roll 1 die on the Great Jagras’ reward table. Place this card to the side of game baord as a reminder.

23.title: Unavenged
text: All hunters suffer 2 damage.

24.title: Time Waster
text: Discard 4 time cards.

25.title: Palico Assistant
text: Draw a random Palico card and give it to a hunter that does not have a Palico. Discard the Palico card at the end of the quest.

26.title: Betrayal
text: If you complete this quest, each player rolls 1 fewer die on the monster's reward table. Place this card to the side of game board as a reminder.

27.title: Turf War
text: Each hunter suffers 2 damage and the monster suffers 5 damage.

28.title: Fumbled Carving
text: Each hunter suffers [poison].

29.title: Rathalos Slayer
text: If you complete this quest, each player may roll 1 die on the Rathalos’ reward table. Place this card to the side of game board as a reminder.

30.title: Recovery
text: The monster regains 5 lost health. If no damage is inflicted during the next hunter's turn, at the end of their turn, the monster regains another 5 lost health.

31.title: Wind Storm
text: Each hunter must move 2 nodes away from the monster.

32.title: Rocksteady Mantle
text: During the next hunter's turn, Kushala Daora counts as having 0 wind tokens on its physiology card.

33.title: Eye of the Storm
text: Remove up to 1 tornado token from the game board.

34.title: Ice Storm
text: Each hunter that doesn't have [r-ice] resistance suffers 3 damage.

35.title: Determined
text: Choose up to 2 discarded time cards and shuffle them back into the time deck.

36.title: Studied Quarry
text: Flip the top card of the monster's behaviour deck face up.

37.title: Surprise Attack
text: Reduce the [hunter-turn] of the next monster behaviour card by 1.

38.title: Spine Breaker
text: During the next player's turn, attack cards which inflict damage but don't have [break] remove 1 spike token from the selected body part as if they had 1 [break].

39.title: Spine Crumble
text: Remove up to 2 white spike tokens from the monster.

40.title: Quenched Blades
text: During the next player's turn, attack cards which inflict damage gain +1 [water].

41.title: Fortuitous Wind
text: Remove up to 4 Blackscale Dust tokens from the game board.

42.title: Barroth Slayer
text: If you complete this quest, each player may choose 1 resource from the Barroth’s reward table. Place this card to the side of the game board as a reminder.

43.title: Time Management
text: If you complete this quest, the group may perform 1 day's worth of downtime activities without spending a campaign day.

44.title: Diablos Slayer
text: If you complete this quest, each player may roll 1 die on the Diablos’ reward table. Place this card to the side of game table as a reminder.

terrain: A hunter on a bush node has –4 threat.
A hunter on a rock node may move 1 node without placing attack cards on their stamina board.
When a hunter enters a pond node for any reason, they must discard 1 card from their damage deck.
monster-status: The monster suffers 2 damage at the end of its next turn.
Only resolve the [hunter-turn] and [hunter-attack] on the monster’s next behavior.
If there is a [movement] on the monster’s next behavior, it has a value of 0.
Each part of the monster has –1 [armor] until the end of its next turn.
hunter-status: The hunter must place a card face-down on their stamina board if possible.
The hunter suffers 2 damage at the end of their next turn.
The hunter cannot place attack cards on their stamina board to attack, move, or dodge until the end of their next turn.
The hunter must discard down to 2 cards.
The hunter has -2 [armor] until the end of their next turn.
skills: When resolving elemental damage, draw 3 and pick one.
Draw +1 damage card on non-elemental attacks.
During the gathering phase, when the hunters gain a potion, they may all immediately recover to full health.
When you draw damage, draw +1, then choose 1 to place on top of your damage deck before inflicting damage.
Once per quest, discard attack cards when dodging.
Draw +1 damage card on non-elemental attacks.
Draw +1 damage card on fire attacks.
While at 2 health or less, draw +1 damage on non-elemental attacks.
Gain +1 armor when playing attacks that grant armor.
Once per quest, reshuffle your empty damage deck during an attack.
Draw +1 damage card on ice attacks.
You can’t suffer damage during the gathering phase.
Gain +1 agility when dodging or sprinting.
Draw +1 damage on your first attack if you suffered damage last monster turn.
Draw +2 damage, but return 2 to the deck.
If you inflict damage to the monster during your turn, recover 1 health.
You may use your Palico ability twice per quest.
You are immune to the poison status.
When applying fire, draw an elemental damage card instead of placing a fire token.
If you recovered health during your previous turn, the first attack you play this turn gains +2 damage.
You’re immune to the sleep status.
Once per quest, apply +1 stun token.
Once per quest, you may use combat actions and preparation actions during the same turn.
When you recover health from anything that isn’t a potion, recover 1 additional health.
You’re immune to the stun status ailment.
Once per quest, shuffle the damage cards from an attack back into the damage deck.
Draw +1 damage card on thunder attacks.
Draw +1 damage card on water attacks.
Attack cards with 2+ combo draw +1 damage.
Once per quest, you may swap your hunter token with another player, maintaining token facing.
downtime: As a group, spending 1 day allow you to perform up to 3 different activities. Every hunter performs the same activity 1 time and then move on to another activity.
Roll 2 die and get 1 resource according to the result.
Remove any 3 Common resource to recieve any 1 Common resource of your choice.
Select 1 elemental type. Each hunter gains +1 resistance to that type during the next quest. Each hunter places a token of the selected elemental type on their weapon card as a reminder.
Replay any Investigation or Tempered Investigation quest in the next day even if you have exceeded 4 attempts.
Give you luck. No actual effect.

weapon: Jagras Blade
Wrapped in supple Jagras hide, this great sword fits firmly in the user's grip.
Datura Blaze
The venom-soaked down of the Pukei-Pukei covering this blade bristles at the sight of prey.
Bone Blade
A great sword made from easily obtainable bone. Rough-hewn, but a sturdy friend to new hunters.
Carapace Buster
Adding Barroth parts only made this great sword more stark and brutish...in a good way.
Red Wing
Crafted from fiery parts in the form of a Rathalos wing, every swing produces a fiery blast.
Buster Blade
A great sword of fine steel, with improved durability and power for more demanding hunts.
Blooming Blade
The Pukei-Pukei's colorful down hides potent venom, making this a lot less cute than it looks.
Icesteel Edge
Throw some Kushala Daora bits together and call it a day. Its icy bite will silence critics.
Bone Slasher
Made from the densest of bones, this great sword offers greater power with the same ease of use.
Flame Blade
Residual heat in the Rathalos parts used in this great sword grants it a searing strike.
Nergal Judicator
The Nergigante scales on this great sword continually regrow, promising unending pain to foes.
Chrome Razor
A lavish great sword of rare steel able to split even the hardest of shells with ease.
Jagras Hacker
Lavish use of butter-soft Jagras hide makes this great sword feel like an extension of its user.
Daora's Decimator
Throw some Kushala Daora bits together and call it a day. Its icy bite will silence critics.
Giant Jawblade
A great sword made of modified bone. The primal force of each swing could split a boulder in two.
Barroth Shredder
Imbued with the destructive might of a Barroth, each swing carves new scars into the earth.
Purgation's Atrocity
Forged from Nergigante parts, it offers solemn judgment to the sinner made to kneel before it.
Jagras Edge
Wrapped in supple Jagras hide, this sword & shield fits firmly in the user's grip.
Datura Blossom
The venom-soaked down of the Pukei-Pukei covering this blade bristles at the sight of prey.
Bone Kukri
A sword & shield made from easily obtainable bone. Rough-hewn, but a sturdy friend to new hunters.
Flame Knife
Residual heat in the Rathalos parts used in this sword & shield grants it a searing strike.
Heat Edge
This sword & shield's blade carries the flame of a Rathalos within it, forever glowing a dull red.
Steel Knife
A sword & shield of fine steel, with improved durability and power for more demanding hunts.
Carapace Edge
Adding Barroth parts only made this sword & shield more stark and brutish...in a good way.
Teostra's Spada
An emblem of the crimson flame king, this Teostra sword & shield is the key to hell's burning gates.
Chief Kukri
Made from the densest of bones, this sword & shield offers greater power with the same ease of use.
Blooming Knife
The Pukei-Pukei's colorful down hides potent venom, making this a lot less cute than it looks.
Nergal Jack
The Nergigante scales on this sword & shield continually regrow, promising unending pain to foes.
Chrome Slicer
A lavish sword & shield of rare steel able to split even the hardest of shells with ease.
Jagras Garotte
Lavish use of butter-soft Jagras hide makes this sword & shield feel like an extension of its user.
Teostra's Emblem
An emblem of the crimson flame king, this Teostra sword & shield is the key to hell's burning gates.
Grand Barong
A sword & shield made of modified bone. Each primal slash is capable of cleaving solid rock.
Barroth Club
Imbued with the destructive might of a Barroth, each slash carves new scars into the earth.
Eradication Vanguard
Forged from Nergigante parts, it severs the chain of grief created by the sinner's acts.
Rending Beaks
Fortified with thin yet durable Kulu-Ya-Ku hide, these dual blades won't weigh you down.
Jyura Hatchets
Unrivaled in ferocity, a flurry of slashes from these Jyuratodus dual blades will shred anything.
Bone Hatchets
Dual blades made from easily obtainable bone. Rough-hewn, but sturdy friends to new hunters.
Blazing Hatchets
Dual blades wrapped in hide tempered hard as iron in the searing breath of an Anjanath.
Diablos Clubs
The absolute power of the tyrant's reign can be felt coursing through these dual blades with every slash.
Dual Slicers
Dual blades of fine steel, with improved durability and power for more demanding hunts.
Madness Pangas
Fortified with Jyuratodus parts and caked in mud, these dual blades are as primal as they are deadly.
Twin Nails
When drawn, ice envelops one arm, flame the other, inflicting terrible pain on the wielder.
Wild Hatchets
Made from the densest of bones, these dual blades offer greater power with the same ease of use.
Diablos Hatchets
Harnessing the power of the desert tyrant, these dual blades gnash at enemies with an oppressive grin.
Nergal Gouge

armor-set.leather: Armor made of treated monster hide. A safe choice, designed for multi-purpose use.
armor-set.chainmail: Armor made of woven chain links. Its familiar design inspires trust in hunters who wear it.
armor-set.alloy: Armor made of fine machalite ore. What it lacks in charm it more than makes up in defense.
armor-set.bone: Traditional armor crafted from monster bones. Believe it or not, it offers pretty good insulation.
armor-set.barr: A wyvern could trample this armor made of Barroth shell and not leave a single crack.
armor-set.g-jagr: Diligently polished Great Jagras scale marries steel in beautiful harmony in this armor.
armor-set.kulu: The elegant color and beautiful design of this Kulu-Ya-Ku armor make it perennially popular.
armor-set.puke: Pukei-Pukei armor engineered to protect vital body parts with a very modest amount of materials.
armor-set.tobi: Exquisitely light, this soft Tobi-Kadachi armor is so comfy you can barely feel it on.
armor-set.anja: Modeled after an unknown hunting tribe's hunting garb, the Anja armor's design is a symbol of bravery.
armor-set.jyur: A special process was used to treat the hard mud caked on this Jyuratodus armor in order to improve durability.
armor-set.a-rath: Azure armor imbued with absolute power. Those who wear it are destined to make history.
armor-set.b-diab: Brutal-looking armor made from Black Diablos parts. So imposing none so much as dare approach it.
armor-set.diab: The bold horns on this Diablos armor are a challenge to any who doubt your rule over the sands.
armor-set.rath: Crafted from parts carved from the King of the Skies, this crimson armor boasts overwhelming defense.
armor-set.kush: Uniquely crafted Kushala Daora armor. The immeasurable strength of a tempered monster dwells within.
armor-set.nerg: Uniquely crafted Nergigante armor. The immeasurable strength of a tempered monster dwells within.
armor-set.teos: Uniquely crafted Teostra armor. The immeasurable strength of a tempered monster dwells within.
